results.title: Tank girl
results.creator_credit: Rachel Talalay, John Watson, Pen Densham, Richard Lewis, Trilogy Entertainment Group and United Artists Corporation
results.brief_description: The year is 2033 and water is a precious commodity. In the desolate wind swept plains, animals are banned, bathing is unheard of, and the Water & Power Company, headed by the villainous Kesslee (Malcolm McDowell), have ultimate control over the precious H20. One rebel girl stands in their way, Rebecca (Lori Petty), a chick with attitude and an outrageous hairstyle. She is captured by Water & Power when they kill her boyfriend, kidnap her young friend, and try to blackmail her into joining their team. As a prisoner Rebecca discovers a new passion- tanks, and makes a friend with mechanic and pilot, Jet Girl (Naomi Watts), who helps her escape. Once free the girls join forces with The Rippers, an army of half men and half kangaroos, genetically modified to be the ultimate fighting machines. Together they take Water & Power head on, lead by Jet Girl in the sky, and tank girl on the ground with her beloved tank in a flurry of live action and comic strip visuals. Cast also includes Ice-T, Don Harvey and Jeff Kober.

results.title: Tapdancin'
results.brief_description: Tap Dancin’ explores the survivors and revivers of the great days of tap dance through performance, interviews and vintage footage which includes the Hoofers, the Copasetics and Bill “Bojangles” Robinson.

results.title: Tango of our childhood
results.creator_credit: Albert Mkrtchyan and Armenfilm U S S R
results.brief_description:
This melancholic comedy is a story of post-war displacement and one man’s sense of conflicting loyalties. Ruben, an Armenian, returns to his family after the war, only to leave them to go live with a nurse who saved his life. His proud wife, struck by the insult, enlists the help of her children in order to entice her husband back to the family home. Lurching between the two homes leaves Ruben in a state of abject confusion about his familial duties and personal needs.

Credits: Director, writer, Albert Mkrtchyan ; photography, Rudolf Vatinian ; music, T. Mansurian ; editing, S. Gabrielyan.
Cast: Galya Novents, Mger Mkrchian, Elina Agamyan, Narine Bagadasaryan, Samvel Sarkisyan, Azat Gasparyan.

results.title: Tango Bar
results.creator_credit: Marcos Zurinaga, Roberto Gandara, Juan Carlos Codazzi, Zaga Films and Beco Films
results.brief_description: Raul Julia stars in this story of a trio of performers who play, sing and dance at the “Tango Bar” in Buenos Aires. The trio are split apart by a revolution in Argentina and reunited after 10 years of exile. Whilst the plot of “Tango Bar” revolves around the story of Pedro (Raul Julia), Elena (Valeria Lynch) and Antonio (Ruben Jaurez), it is primarily a tribute to Tango in Argentina. As they perform their show at the Tango Bar - singing, dancing tango and talking about its history and politics, the film flashes to dance sequences of tango performed at various times in the history of the dance form. In Spanish with English subtitles.

results.title: A Tale of springtime = Conte de printemps
results.creator_credit: Eric Rohmer, Margaret Menegoz and Les Films du Losange
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Tales of the four seasons = Contes des quatre saisons”.
The first in a series of films by Eric Rohmer based on the four seasons, “Le Conte de printemps” is essentially a chamber piece about the interaction of six characters (one of whom never appears). The characters are made up of three couples, whose centre is the developing friendship between the cerebral Jeanne and the instinctive Natasha. Rohmer’s visual style is restrained and unobtrusive, but also gloriously cinematic. There are flowers blooming everywhere, signs of rebirth, of hope, of the opportunites that life has to offer, and teasingly, the possibilities that lie just beyond the grasp of the flawed humanity that populates this film. Cast includes Anne Teyssedre, Hugues Quester, Florence Darel, Eloise Bennett, Sophie Robin.

results.title: Talk radio
results.creator_credit: Oliver Stone, A. Kitman Ho, Edward Pressman and Cineplex Odeon
results.brief_description: Based on the book “Talked to death: the life and murder of Alan Berg” by Stephen Singular, this film presents an often unseen side of talk radio of paranoia and passion. Eric Bogosian (who also wrote the play based on Singular’s book) stars as a contentious talk show host. He pushes the boundaries of political correctness and inspires emotions of love or hate from his listeners. His provocative broadcasts push one caller too far, leading to dire consequences. Also starring Alec Baldwin, Ellen Greene and John Pankow.
